|I just tried to use http://parkert.com/crawlertestdist/.
|
|It continues to have the problem observed a while back (See message
|below).  Whats up w/ that?

Hrrm, I never got this message.  This appears to be part of the larger
problem with IA mail not getting delivered (which is really getting a bit
frustrating).

As for the errors, thanks for the feedback.  I'll endeavor to get these
problems fixed this weekend.  Also, crawl08 has a working copy (should be
the same as the code you referenced) you can use:

  http://crawl08.archive.org/

I just realized I announced a copy on crawl08 in my original message, but
pasted the URL you referenced.  Sorry for the confusion.

cc'ing the list to have a record of this report, and also so I know this 
gets through....

pt.
-- 
Parker Thompson
The Internet Archive
510.541.0125

On Wed, 28 Jan 2004, stackarchiveorg wrote:

|I just tried to use http://parkert.com/crawlertestdist/.
|
|It continues to have the problem observed a while back (See message
|below).  Whats up w/ that?
|
|Thanks,
|St.Ack
|
|
|
|From: Michael Stack <stack@...>
|Date: Wed, 31 Dec 2003 09:16:49 -0800
|Subject: Re: [archive-crawler] crawler testing.
|
|It looks really good.  I'd like to play w/ it.  Can you first give me 
|feedback on the below?
|
|+ "Error: Invalid Crawler Supplied" whenever I tried 'creating test set' 
|(Selected 'heritrix', then filled out next screen variously -- if I left 
|it empty or filled in a bunch of text it still gave me the error 
|message).  This stops me being able to use the tool (Yesterday it seemed 
|to work -- it at least generated a seed url for me).
|+ Title is also misspelled on home page.
|+ I added a crawler.  Its named heritrix too but had a different 
|version.  In drop down it only shows the crawler name, not version, so 
|its hard for me to distingush between the two.
|+ I see on disk and in your commit of last night that tests on the 
|filesystem are named 'test1', 'test3' etc.  Do they have to be named 
|so?  Could they have more meaningful names so the 'background image 
|extraction' test (test1) was  contained in a directory named 
|'bkgrd_image_extraction' or some such.
|+ Whats 'webroot' in the 'Add Test' page?
|
|Thanks Parker,
|St.Ack
|
|
|
|
|--- In archive-crawler@yahoogroups.com, Parker Thompson <parkert@a...>
|wrote:
|> Soren,
|> 
|> This means that the requisite PHP PEAR DB libraries are not
|installed.  I
|> believe this can be fixed by using a newer version of PHP, though
|you can
|> as easily fix the problem by grabbing the libraries from crawl08. 
|If you
|> do that (as I did on crawl08) you'll need:
|> 
|> /0/apache/webgarden_docroot/DB/
|> /0/apache/webgarden_docroot/HTML/
|> /0/apache/webgarden_docroot/HTML_Common-1.2.1/
|> /0/apache/webgarden_docroot/HTML_Table-1.5/
|> 
|> And one other caviat.  To load the database you'll have to comment
|out the 
|> line '\connect - parkert' in crawlertesting.sql.  I missed this
|since it 
|> doesn't error out on my machine (or grab the working version from 
|> crawl08).  I'll get an updated version in CVS as soon as I get my
|laptop 
|> up and running again.
|> 
|> Thanks for giving it a go, please let me know if you hit any more 
|> speed bumps.  
|> 
|> pt.
|> -- 
|> Parker Thompson
|> The Internet Archive
|> 510.541.0125
|>
